optimizer.resetpanel package¶

Submodules¶

optimizer.resetpanel.UIresetpanel module¶

class optimizer.resetpanel.UIresetpanel.Ui_Form[source]¶

Bases: object

retranslateUi(Form)[source]¶
setupUi(Form)[source]¶

optimizer.resetpanel.resetpanel module¶

PYQT interface for running OCELOT simplex optimization. Created as a QT widget for use in other applications as well. Tyler Cope, 2016 The class was modified and was introduced new methods. S. Tomin, 2017

class optimizer.resetpanel.resetpanel.ResetpanelWindow(parent=None)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QFrame

Main GUI class for the resetpanel.

getStartValues()[source]¶

Initializes start values for the PV list.

initTable()[source]¶

Initialize the UI table object

launchPopupAll()[source]¶

Launches the ARE YOU SURE popup window for pv reset.

loadStyleSheet()[source]¶

Load in the dark theme style sheet.

resetAll()[source]¶

Set all PVs back to their reference values.

updateCurrentValues()[source]¶

Method to update the table on every clock cycle. Loops through the pv list and gets new data, then updates the Current Value column. Hard coded to turn Current Value column red at 0.1% differenct from Ref Value. It would be better to update the table on a callback, but PyEpics crashes with cb funcitons.

updateReference()[source]¶

Updates reference values for all PVs on button click.

optimizer.resetpanel.resetpanel.main()[source]¶

Main functino to open a resetpanel GUI. If passed a file name, will try and load PV list from that file. Otherwise defaults to a file in the base directory with pre-loaded common tuned PVs.

optimizer.resetpanel.resetpanelbox module¶

Subclass of ResetpanelWindow, used to make a version with check box selction

Tyler Cope, 2016

The class was modified and was introduced new methods.

  1. Tomin, 2017
class optimizer.resetpanel.resetpanelbox.ResetpanelBoxWindow(parent=None)[source]¶

Bases: ocelot.optimizer.resetpanel.resetpanel.ResetpanelWindow

The main GUI class to add in checkboxes, subclassed from the ResetPanelWindow class.

addCheckBoxes()[source]¶

Creats additional column in UI table for check box.

Must be called again if the user adds another PV with middle click function.

addPv(pv)[source]¶

Add another PV to the GUI on middle click.

Args:
pv (str): String name of the PV to add
getPvList(pvs_in=None)[source]¶

Redefine method to add in checkboxes when getting the PV list.

Copied from resetpanel.py

getPvsFromCbState()[source]¶

Gets list of all pvs that have checked boxes.

Returns:
List of PV strings
getRows(state)[source]¶

Method to set the UI checkbox state from slected rows.

Loops though the rows and gets the selected state from the ‘Active” column. If highlighted, check box is set the the ‘state’ input arg.

Args:
state (bool): Bool of whether the boxes should be checked or unchecked.
get_devices(pvs)[source]¶
get_limits(pv)[source]¶
get_state()[source]¶
launchPopupAll()[source]¶

Launches the ARE YOU SURE popup for pv reset value function.

Rewrote to change the warning string to say “checkbox selected” instead of “all” to avoid confusion with number of devices being reset.

mouseReleaseEvent(evt)[source]¶

Get PV coppied from the system clipboard on button release

Button 4 is the middle click button.

resetAll()[source]¶

Resets all PVs with a box checked.

Rewrote this function to only change selected rows, not all rows.

set_machine_interface(mi, dp)[source]¶
set_parent(parent)[source]¶
set_state(table)[source]¶
uncheckBoxes()[source]¶

Method to unchecked all active boxes

updateReference()[source]¶

Update reference values for selected rows.

Rewrote this function to only update slected rows, not all.

class optimizer.resetpanel.resetpanelbox.customTW(parent)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QTableWidget

Subclass the tablewidget to add a custom PV on middle click.

contextMenuEvent(event)[source]¶
deleteSlot(rows)[source]¶
mouseReleaseEvent(evt)[source]¶

Grabs string from the clipboard if middle button click.

Tries to then add the PV to the parent GUI pv lists. Calls parent.addPv() method.

Args:
evt (QEvent): Event object passed in from QT
mouseReleaseEvent_mclick(evt)[source]¶

Grabs string from the clipboard if middle button click.

Tries to then add the PV to the parent GUI pv lists. Calls parent.addPv() method.

Args:
evt (QEvent): Event object passed in from QT
